item.title: DOCSIS 3.1 Makes Cable Act Like Fiber
item.description:
By: John Shepler Cable broadband has undergone significant technological advancements, making it a strong competitor to fiber optic bandwidth for many businesses. Companies that previously considered cable as a backup option are now finding its blend of high performance and affordability too attractive to disregard. Let’s explore the advancements in cable technology and the options it presents for businesses. Magic #1: The HFC Cable Plant Cable television started as a basic system, essentially a collection of large antennas feeding signals to distribution amplifiers, providing an improved version of over-the-air television...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/docsis-31-makes-cable-act-like-fiber/
